section.title: Horizon Timeout
section.p: The default session timeout for Horizon is 1800 seconds or 30 minutes. This is the recommended default and best practice for those concerned with security.

As an administrator, you can change the session timeout by changing the value of the SESSION_TIMEOUT to anything less than or equal to 14400, which is equal to four hours. Values greater than 14400 are likely to conflict with the default OpenStack auth token timeouts.
section.note: Increasing the value of SESSION_TIMEOUT increases the risk of abuse.

section.title: Steps
section.p: Follow these steps to change and commit the Horizon timeout value.

ol.li: Change the value of SESSION_TIMEOUT to suit your needs
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Commit changes to Horizon with this playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost horizon-reconfigure.yml
